Define Documentation

#define FILE_TYPE_CACHE   (1 << 2)

Used to search a cache file into standard directories.

#define FILE_TYPE_CONFIG   (1 << 0)

Used to search a configuration file into standard directories.

#define FILE_TYPE_DATA   (1 << 1)

Used to search a ressource into standard directories.

Function Documentation

gchar * find_file ( guint  type,
const gchar *  filename 
)
Parameters:
typeType of file to find (FILE_TYPE_CONFIG, FILE_TYPE_DATA or FILE_TYPE_CACHE).
filenameName of the file to find.
Returns:
Path to the file, or NULL if not found.

Find a file into the user/system directories.

Parameters:

const char *  replace,
const char *  string 
)
Parameters:
searchText to search into the string
replaceReplace search by the specified text
stringString to modify
Returns:
A newly allocated string.

gboolean uri_scheme_parse ( UriScheme *  u,
const gchar *  uri 
)
Parameters:
uA pointer to UriScheme structure.
uriA valid URI to parse.
Returns:
TRUE on success, FALSE otherwise.

Parse a valid URI into a structure to access easily to useful URI's data (see UriScheme).

 UriScheme uri;
 uri_scheme_parse (&uri, "http://user:password@google.com:847/sub/page.html?a=connect#anchor");

 printf ("Scheme:   %s\n", uri.scheme);
 printf ("Userinfo: %s\n", uri.userinfo);
 printf ("Hostname: %s\n", uri.hostname);
 printf ("Port:     %d\n", uri.port);
 printf ("Path:     %s\n", uri.path);
 printf ("Query:    %s\n", uri.query);
 printf ("Fragment: %s\n", uri.fragment);
